appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 8, 2026 12:00pm-2:06pm EST
appearances.snippet: grace meng shelley chellie pingree and marcy kaptur. i thank them for their partnership and collaboration which was instrumental to this effort. as we look forward to ahead to today's action, uh, republicans are strongest when they are focused. democrats are more effective when they negotiate in good faith, and the country is better off when republicans and democrats work together. in this statement of administration and its statement of administrative policy on this package, the white house said in part, quote, the administration urges every member of congress to support this fiscally responsible bill, which is a win for the american taxpayer. not surprisingly, i completely agree. i look forward to enacting these full year appropriations and taking every action to complete our work. with that, mr. speaker, i reserve the balance of my time. >> jennifer, oklahoma reserves. what purpose does gentlelady from connecticut seek recognition? >> thank you, mr. speaker. i yield myself five minutes. >> gentlelady is recognized for five minutes. >

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives House Leaders Debate Bill to Reopen Federal Government : CSPAN : January 1, 2026 6:11am-6:39am EST
appearances.snippet: , steny hoyer, the great jim clyburn, maxine waters, elijah cummings, charlie wrangle, our own marcie kaptur, the longest serving woman in the history of the united states house of representatives. peeve all had the opportunity to serve with legendary figures, tom dingell. too numerous to mention. but one can't call that roll without calling the name of the great john lewis. i had the distinct honor of serving with john lewis in the house of representatives, many of us did. i'll never forget on my first day in the congress, i had the opportunity to meet john lewis for the first time in person, and he called me over to see him on the house floor. and he just asked me a simple question. he said, are you the new guy? and i said yes, sir, mr. lewis, i am. and he said, well, we're colleagues now, you don't have to call me mr. lewis. you can call me john. i said yes, sir, mr. lewis, i understand. and then he said to me, you're from brooklyn, right? now, mr. speaker, i have to be honest, i was tempted to say brooklyn is always in the house but instead, since my mother raised me with some sense, ani

appearances.title: CNN This Morning : CNNW : January 16, 2026 3:00am-4:00am PST
appearances.snippet: madison sheehan announced she is leaving to challenge longtime democratic congresswoman marcy kapturohio. her departure comes amid heightened scrutiny scrutiny of ice's recent violent tactics, and federal prosecutors have charged 26 people, including more than a dozen former ncaa basketball players, in an alleged betting and point shaving scheme that rigged college and chinese professional games, officials say. gamblers recruited players with bribes to manipulate games as recently as last season, prosecutors allege four of the players charged actually played for their current teams in the last few days. and now i want to talk about the new cnn polling out this morning. it finds that president trump underwater with voters on a range of issues. one year into his second term. among independent voters, 66% believe the second term is a failure. when asked which issue is the most important, the economy was overwhelmingly picked as number one, meaning it could be top of mind for voters in the midterms. this year, 62% of independents say that trump's policies have worsened economic condition

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 6, 2026 6:29pm-8:20pm EST
appearances.snippet: for his remarks, and with that, i'd like to yield one minute to the gentlelady from ohio, miss marcy kaptur. >> i thank you, congressman clyburn. respect you for your leadership as one of the members of the house that was trapped up in that gallery for hours and hours against my will on january 6th, 2021. i rise this evening to say the rioters who created the chaos that day here at the capitol were un-american. they were violent. they were unlawful. and i rise to pay tribute to the seven officers who died, the 150 that were injured, many of whom were hospitalized, and some deal with the ptsd until today. last on the on march 2022, a year following that, this congress passed a law directing the architect of the capitol to place a permanent memorial to honor every one of those officers who had violence perpetrated against them. and five years after that tragic day, the plaque is here in the capitol, but the speaker has not allowed it to be placed. so i rise to urge speaker johnson to not allow his worship of one man to rewrite the history of that horrible day. congress must show respect for t

appearances.title: Chris Jansing Reports : MSNOW : January 15, 2026 9:00am-11:00am PST
appearances.snippet: she's resigned to run for congress against ohio incumbent marcy kaptur. a posting on x.of the work we have done to protect american families. do you think that these races potentially are a referendum, not just on ice, but i think on trump's determination to remake what america looks like. >> yes, midterm elections are always a referendum on the administration, and this will be the first midterms of president trump's second term. and so that's been the conversation this whole time about what what the midterm elections will say about president trump's second term. but, chris, i want to go back to one other thing about the new york governor's race that the republican candidate needs to keep in mind, and i'm sure they're paying attention to this. yes, new york state is a big state. and once you get outside of the five boroughs of new york, it gets increasingly red, both upstate, but also as you go along long island. but the primary driver of votes in new york state is new york city. and if you are a republican and you pay attention to the million plus votes zoran mamdani wo

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 8, 2026 6:30pm-8:52pm EST
appearances.snippet: kaptur, for marcy kaptur for 30 minutes. >> thank you, mr. speaker.s past weekend i prayed in thanks to god for saving the lives of every single one of our precious soldiers, sailors, airmen, marines and intelligence officers who were deployed secretly to venezuela by the president of the united states without consent of congress. importantly, this operation was planned and executed in violation of the us constitution. article one, section nine, clause seven and i quote. no money shall be drawn from the treasury, but in consequence of appropriations made by law, and that clause also requires publication of all public expended money funds. none of that came to congress, even in some of the most sequestered private meetings. nothing. no information, no support. this military operation expended billions upon billions of us taxpayer funds. the prior speaker, the congressman, talked about the deficit going up. well, well, where did the money that was not appropriated come from? no one could be more grateful than i that our valiant combat teams all came hom
